summary: In this context, 8-epi-PGF2alpha, a marker of oxidative stress, is examined in relation to respiratory physiology, particularly in children with asthma. The study highlights that while 8-epi-PGF2alpha levels in exhaled breath condensate (EBC) do not correlate with lung function tests, they indicate ongoing oxidative stress and inflammation in asthmatic children. This suggests that 8-epi-PGF2alpha may play a role in understanding respiratory physiology and the pathophysiology of asthma, particularly in assessing lung inflammation and treatment responses.
